content: double thick potholder designed by tandy imhoff finished size 7 x 7 materials 1 hank cascade sierra quatro 194 yds or 1 skein sugar n cream 121 yds crochet hook size h tapestry needle note each potholder requires approximately 75 yds of worsted weight yarn therefore 2 potholders are possible from a single hank of cascade sierra quatro whereas 1 ½ is possible from sugar n cream do not use acrylic yarns use only cotton and/or wool as they will not melt in high heat circumstances gauge not terribly important on this project 16 st x 13 ½ row = 4 instructions chain 26 row 1 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each chain across 25 sts row 2 chain 1 turn *insert hook through hump of chain and back loop of previous row complete single_crochet st repeat from * across row 3 chain 1 turn using remaining front loop and the back loop of previous row single_crochet across repeat row 3 for a total of 20 row on front and back do not finish off edging single_crochet 2 more times in last st to turn corner turn sideways and single_crochet 18 times along the edge 3 single_crochet in last st turn and single_crochet in remaining loop of chain 24x with 3 single_crochet in last st turn and single_crochet 19x along side with 3 single_crochet in last st turn and *insert hook through both loops of row facing you and remaining front loop of row on back complete single_crochet repeat from * across slip_stitch into 1st corner st do not finish off optional loop chain 9 slip_stitch into next corner st single_crochet in same st turn single_crochet 8x into chain loop single_crochet into 1st slip_stitch finish off and weave in ends to complete without loop slip_stitch into 2nd corner st finish off and weave in ends coasters following same stitch pattern as described above for potholders start with chain 16 15 finished sts and follow instructions for 12 row both sides complete with edging without loop
